p: The levels of 4-HHE and 4-HNE in the heart tissue were 312 ± 55 and 774 ± 118 ng/g tissue, respectively, in the control group, and 1331 ± 168 and 642 ± 58 ng/g tissue, respectively, in the DHA pups ( Figure 3A). These results led to a 5.2-fold increase of 4-HHE/4-HNE ratio in the heart when comparing the DHA pups with controls ( Figure 3B, p < 0.0001).
